hackathon-description-text: Bitcamp is a place for exploration. You will have 36 hours to delve into your curiosities, learn something new, and make something awesome. With world-class mentors and hundreds of fellow campers, you’re in for an amazing time. If you’re ready for an adventure, see you by the fire!
hackathon-rules:
Don’t use an old project, start something new instead! Obviously, alcohol, drugs, firearms, knives, weapons (including toys) are stricly forbidden. Read through our 
 for more details.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A Silver Pebble Steel for each member of the winning team.

You will enjoy a 2 day all expenses paid trip to Austin, TX, the home to the world-class IBM Design Studio! You’ll tour our fun and creative space, have 1:1 time with our team, get valuable feedback on your work, obtain career advice, visit the Watson Lab, and network with executives. We’ll put you up in a great hotel in the heart of downtown and make sure you get to try some fantastic Texas BBQ!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Application Built on IBM Bluemix platform.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: da Vinci 3D Printer (for up to 4 team members)
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen's Best DC Data Hack using DC’s Open Data Catalog (http://data.octo.dc.gov/)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best Digital Forensics Hack (data recovery/carving, file reconstruction, steganography, facial recognition, smartphone app data extraction, reverse engineering tools, etc.)
“Most innovative use or implementation of ‘every day’ tech”, meaning: Show me something that will change my life so much I will use it every day in the future.
The winners of MetaMind's API prize will receive an Emotiv EPOC + EEG headset!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack built with the Twitter API and/or Fabric SDK.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1st prize: Xbox One for each team member (max 4)
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best hack with a Microsoft product

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Bose Speakers for the winning team

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: FINRA: Best hack utilizing end-of-day stock price data (provided) for companies trading on the NYSE, AMEX and NASDAQ stock exchanges.
FINRA: Best hack combining publicly available investment advisor data (provided) with other public data sources to help evaluate the character of investment advisors.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $300 Donation to the Charity of your choice, in your name
$250 Amazon Gift Card for each participant
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Capital One API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Kindle Fire HD for each team member. Best comments hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: FINRA: Best hack utilizing a FINRA-sponsored open-source project (http://finraos.github.io).

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $250 Namecheap Credit for Best .me Domain Name registered at Bitcamp!
Raspberry Pi or Teensy Device or Spark Core for each Team Member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Coolest Use of Hardware Prize by Bookholders

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $100 Gift Certificate off Textbooks for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Use of Classdata API or Video Feeds by Bookholders

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A tour of Red Hats local DC office, and sit down with employees. (no travel funded, local winners only)
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: "Most open submission (open source or design) (local entries only)"
EPA Hack Idea: Nature App to Identify "Ecospots"

hackathon-description-header: 36h Hackathon at the University of Maryland, College Park.
